intro: Polyscias flynnii, commonly known as the broadleaf sycamore, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by orange-red berries. Polyscias flynnii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for both indoor and outdoor gardening.
